posts.name: Sam
posts.cooked:
What’s the best way to connect the items in the title?  I’m currently planning on taking the cable from the Hall effect sensor and soldering to a data breakout board, but I feel like there ought to be a way to do it that doesn’t require soldering.

We have an absolute encoder adapter as well if that would be useful here, and various cables.

posts.name: James Lyon
posts.cooked: Can you post the Sensor you are talking about? I don’t know of any REV hall effect sensor

posts.name: Sam
posts.cooked:
Yea sorry, I should’ve linked it.

REV Robotics designs, builds and manufactures robotics parts and components used by students for learning about science, technology, engineering, and math (STEM). Our parts are commonly used within the FIRST Robotics Competition and the FIRST Tech...

Price: USD 16

It’s the magnetic limit switch, but my team has just been calling it the Hall Effect sensor since that’s what it uses.

posts.name: Alex
posts.cooked: We just wired ours to the Rio DIO ports.

posts.name: Sam
posts.cooked: I’m aware that’s an option, but I’m trying to avoid it in this case because of the wire run it would require.

posts.name: Jim Sokoloff
posts.cooked:
You could take a cable like this , cut it in half, and crimp JST-PH pins onto it, I suppose.

Or take the correct pitch IDC connectors (please verify that those are correct) and pin them to the wires coming off the JST-PH cable that ships with the limit switch.

If you have the breakout in your hand already though, I’d just solder it and move along.

posts.name: Michael Tucker
posts.cooked: You can wire that sensor to the Rev encoder breakout board using the 5V, Gnd, and one of the sensor outputs to either the Fwd or Rev input on the SparkMax.

posts.name: Sam
posts.cooked: That’s what we did, we just wanted to avoid soldering it if possible.  We ended up soldering it in that manner tho.

data.title: Connecting REV Hall Effect Sensor to SparkMAX
data.fancy_title: Connecting REV Hall Effect Sensor to SparkMAX

accepted_answer.excerpt: You can wire that sensor to the Rev encoder breakout board using the 5V, Gnd, and one of the sensor outputs to either the Fwd or Rev input on the SparkMax.
